trans-unit.source: This article shows you how to capture a variable photo sequence, which allows you to capture multiple frames of images in rapid succession and configure each frame to use different focus, flash, ISO, exposure, and exposure compensation settings.
trans-unit.target: This article shows you how to capture a variable photo sequence, which allows you to capture multiple frames of images in rapid succession and configure each frame to use different focus, flash, ISO, exposure, and exposure compensation settings.

trans-unit.source: Variable photo sequence
trans-unit.target: Variable photo sequence

trans-unit.source: Variable photo sequence
trans-unit.target: Variable photo sequence

trans-unit.source: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: \[ Updated for UWP apps on Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]
trans-unit.target: For Windows 8.x articles, see the [archive](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/p/?linkid=619132) \]

trans-unit.source: This article shows you how to capture a variable photo sequence, which allows you to capture multiple frames of images in rapid succession and configure each frame to use different focus, flash, ISO, exposure, and exposure compensation settings.
trans-unit.target: This article shows you how to capture a variable photo sequence, which allows you to capture multiple frames of images in rapid succession and configure each frame to use different focus, flash, ISO, exposure, and exposure compensation settings.

trans-unit.source: This feature enables scenarios like creating High Dynamic Range (HDR) images.
trans-unit.target: This feature enables scenarios like creating High Dynamic Range (HDR) images.

trans-unit.source: If you want to capture HDR images but don't want to implement your own processing algorithm, you can use the [**AdvancedPhotoCapture**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181386) API to use the HDR capabilities built-in to Windows.
trans-unit.target: If you want to capture HDR images but don't want to implement your own processing algorithm, you can use the [**AdvancedPhotoCapture**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/mt181386) API to use the HDR capabilities built-in to Windows.

trans-unit.source: For more information, see [High Dynamic Range (HDR) photo capture](high-dynamic-range-hdr-photo-capture.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information, see [High Dynamic Range (HDR) photo capture](high-dynamic-range-hdr-photo-capture.md).

trans-unit.source: Note
trans-unit.target: Note

trans-unit.source: This article builds on concepts and code discussed in [Capture Photos and Video with MediaCapture](capture-photos-and-video-with-mediacapture.md), which describes the steps for implementing basic photo and video capture.
trans-unit.target: This article builds on concepts and code discussed in [Capture Photos and Video with MediaCapture](capture-photos-and-video-with-mediacapture.md), which describes the steps for implementing basic photo and video capture.

trans-unit.source: It is recommended that you familiarize yourself with the basic media capture pattern in that article before moving on to more advanced capture scenarios.
trans-unit.target: It is recommended that you familiarize yourself with the basic media capture pattern in that article before moving on to more advanced capture scenarios.

trans-unit.source: The code in this article assumes that your app already has an instance of MediaCapture that has been properly initialized.
trans-unit.target: The code in this article assumes that your app already has an instance of MediaCapture that has been properly initialized.

trans-unit.source: Set up your app to use variable photo sequence capture
trans-unit.target: Set up your app to use variable photo sequence capture

trans-unit.source: In addition to the namespaces required for basic media capture, implementing a variable photo sequence capture requires the following namespaces.
trans-unit.target: In addition to the namespaces required for basic media capture, implementing a variable photo sequence capture requires the following namespaces.

trans-unit.source: VPSUsing
trans-unit.target: VPSUsing

trans-unit.source: Declare a member variable to store the [**VariablePhotoSequenceCapture**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn652564) object, which is used to initiate the photo sequence capture.
trans-unit.target: Declare a member variable to store the [**VariablePhotoSequenceCapture**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn652564) object, which is used to initiate the photo sequence capture.

trans-unit.source: Declare an array of [**SoftwareBitmap**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887358) objects to store each captured image in the sequence.
trans-unit.target: Declare an array of [**SoftwareBitmap**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887358) objects to store each captured image in the sequence.

trans-unit.source: Also, declare an array to store the [**CapturedFrameControlValues**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn608020) object for each frame.
trans-unit.target: Also, declare an array to store the [**CapturedFrameControlValues**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn608020) object for each frame.

trans-unit.source: This can be used by your image processing algorithm to determine what settings were used to capture each frame.
trans-unit.target: This can be used by your image processing algorithm to determine what settings were used to capture each frame.

trans-unit.source: Finally, declare an index that will be used to track which image in the sequence is currently being captured.
trans-unit.target: Finally, declare an index that will be used to track which image in the sequence is currently being captured.

trans-unit.source: VPSMemberVariables
trans-unit.target: VPSMemberVariables

trans-unit.source: Prepare the variable photo sequence capture
trans-unit.target: Prepare the variable photo sequence capture

trans-unit.source: After you have initialized your [MediaCapture](capture-photos-and-video-with-mediacapture.md), make sure that variable photo sequences are supported on the current device by getting an instance of the [**VariablePhotoSequenceController**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn640573) from the media capture's [**VideoDeviceController**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226825) and checking the [**Supported**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn640580) property.
trans-unit.target: After you have initialized your [MediaCapture](capture-photos-and-video-with-mediacapture.md), make sure that variable photo sequences are supported on the current device by getting an instance of the [**VariablePhotoSequenceController**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn640573) from the media capture's [**VideoDeviceController**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/br226825) and checking the [**Supported**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn640580) property.

trans-unit.source: IsVPSSupported
trans-unit.target: IsVPSSupported

trans-unit.source: Get a [**FrameControlCapabilities**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn652548) object from the variable photo sequence controller.
trans-unit.target: Get a [**FrameControlCapabilities**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn652548) object from the variable photo sequence controller.

trans-unit.source: This object has a property for every setting that can be configured per frame of a photo sequence.
trans-unit.target: This object has a property for every setting that can be configured per frame of a photo sequence.

trans-unit.source: These include:
trans-unit.target: These include:

trans-unit.source: Exposure
trans-unit.target: Exposure

trans-unit.source: ExposureCompensation
trans-unit.target: ExposureCompensation

trans-unit.source: Flash
trans-unit.target: Flash

trans-unit.source: Focus
trans-unit.target: Focus

trans-unit.source: IsoSpeed
trans-unit.target: IsoSpeed

trans-unit.source: PhotoConfirmation
trans-unit.target: PhotoConfirmation

trans-unit.source: This example will set a different exposure compensation value for each frame.
trans-unit.target: This example will set a different exposure compensation value for each frame.

trans-unit.source: To verify that exposure compensation is supported for photo sequences on the current device, check the [**Supported**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278905) property of the [**FrameExposureCompensationCapabilities**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn652628) object accessed through the **ExposureCompensation** property.
trans-unit.target: To verify that exposure compensation is supported for photo sequences on the current device, check the [**Supported**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn278905) property of the [**FrameExposureCompensationCapabilities**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn652628) object accessed through the **ExposureCompensation** property.

trans-unit.source: IsExposureCompensationSupported
trans-unit.target: IsExposureCompensationSupported

trans-unit.source: Create a new [**FrameController**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn652582) object for each frame you want to capture.
trans-unit.target: Create a new [**FrameController**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn652582) object for each frame you want to capture.

trans-unit.source: This example captures three frames.
trans-unit.target: This example captures three frames.

trans-unit.source: Set the values for the controls you want to vary for each frame.
trans-unit.target: Set the values for the controls you want to vary for each frame.

trans-unit.source: Then, clear the [**DesiredFrameControllers**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn640574) collection of the **VariablePhotoSequenceController** and add each frame controller to the collection.
trans-unit.target: Then, clear the [**DesiredFrameControllers**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn640574) collection of the **VariablePhotoSequenceController** and add each frame controller to the collection.

trans-unit.source: InitFrameControllers
trans-unit.target: InitFrameControllers

trans-unit.source: Create an [**ImageEncodingProperties**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700993) object to set the encoding you want to use for the captured images.
trans-unit.target: Create an [**ImageEncodingProperties**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/hh700993) object to set the encoding you want to use for the captured images.

trans-unit.source: Call the static method [**MediaCapture.PrepareVariablePhotoSequenceCaptureAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn608097), passing in the encoding properties.
trans-unit.target: Call the static method [**MediaCapture.PrepareVariablePhotoSequenceCaptureAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn608097), passing in the encoding properties.

trans-unit.source: This method returns a [**VariablePhotoSequenceCapture**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn652564) object.
trans-unit.target: This method returns a [**VariablePhotoSequenceCapture**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn652564) object.

trans-unit.source: Finally, register event handlers for the [**PhotoCaptured**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn652573) and [**Stopped**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn652585) events.
trans-unit.target: Finally, register event handlers for the [**PhotoCaptured**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn652573) and [**Stopped**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn652585) events.

trans-unit.source: PrepareVPS
trans-unit.target: PrepareVPS

trans-unit.source: Start the variable photo sequence capture
trans-unit.target: Start the variable photo sequence capture

trans-unit.source: To start the capture of the variable photo sequence, call [**VariablePhotoSequenceCapture.StartAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn652577).
trans-unit.target: To start the capture of the variable photo sequence, call [**VariablePhotoSequenceCapture.StartAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn652577).

trans-unit.source: Be sure to initialize the arrays for storing the captured images and frame control values and set the current index to 0.
trans-unit.target: Be sure to initialize the arrays for storing the captured images and frame control values and set the current index to 0.

trans-unit.source: Set your app's recording state variable and update your UI to disable starting another capture while this capture is in progress.
trans-unit.target: Set your app's recording state variable and update your UI to disable starting another capture while this capture is in progress.

trans-unit.source: StartVPSCapture
trans-unit.target: StartVPSCapture

trans-unit.source: Receive the captured frames
trans-unit.target: Receive the captured frames

trans-unit.source: The [**PhotoCaptured**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn652573) event is raised for each captured frame.
trans-unit.target: The [**PhotoCaptured**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn652573) event is raised for each captured frame.

trans-unit.source: Save the frame control values and captured image for the frame and then increment the current frame index.
trans-unit.target: Save the frame control values and captured image for the frame and then increment the current frame index.

trans-unit.source: This example shows how to get a [**SoftwareBitmap**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887358) representation of each frame.
trans-unit.target: This example shows how to get a [**SoftwareBitmap**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn887358) representation of each frame.

trans-unit.source: For more information on using **SoftwareBitmap**, see [Imaging](imaging.md).
trans-unit.target: For more information on using **SoftwareBitmap**, see [Imaging](imaging.md).

trans-unit.source: OnPhotoCaptured
trans-unit.target: OnPhotoCaptured

trans-unit.source: Handle the completion of the variable photo sequence capture
trans-unit.target: Handle the completion of the variable photo sequence capture

trans-unit.source: The [**Stopped**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn652585) event is raised when all of the frames in the sequence have been captured.
trans-unit.target: The [**Stopped**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn652585) event is raised when all of the frames in the sequence have been captured.

trans-unit.source: Update the recording state of your app and update your UI to allow the user to initiate new captures.
trans-unit.target: Update the recording state of your app and update your UI to allow the user to initiate new captures.

trans-unit.source: At this point, you can pass the captured images and frame control values to your image processing code.
trans-unit.target: At this point, you can pass the captured images and frame control values to your image processing code.

trans-unit.source: OnStopped
trans-unit.target: OnStopped

trans-unit.source: Update frame controllers
trans-unit.target: Update frame controllers

trans-unit.source: If you want to perform another variable photo sequence capture with different per frame settings, you don't need to completely reinitialize the **VariablePhotoSequenceCapture**.
trans-unit.target: If you want to perform another variable photo sequence capture with different per frame settings, you don't need to completely reinitialize the **VariablePhotoSequenceCapture**.

trans-unit.source: You can either clear the [**DesiredFrameControllers**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn640574) collection and add new frame controllers or you can modify the existing frame controller values.
trans-unit.target: You can either clear the [**DesiredFrameControllers**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn640574) collection and add new frame controllers or you can modify the existing frame controller values.

trans-unit.source: The following example checks the [**FrameFlashCapabilities**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn652657) object to verify that the current device supports flash and flash power for variable photo sequence frames.
trans-unit.target: The following example checks the [**FrameFlashCapabilities**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn652657) object to verify that the current device supports flash and flash power for variable photo sequence frames.

trans-unit.source: If so, each frame is updated to enable the flash at 100% power.
trans-unit.target: If so, each frame is updated to enable the flash at 100% power.

trans-unit.source: The exposure compensation values that were previously set for each frame are still active.
trans-unit.target: The exposure compensation values that were previously set for each frame are still active.

trans-unit.source: UpdateFrameControllers
trans-unit.target: UpdateFrameControllers

trans-unit.source: Clean up the variable photo sequence capture
trans-unit.target: Clean up the variable photo sequence capture

trans-unit.source: When you are done capturing variable photo sequences or your app is suspending, clean up the variable photo sequence object by calling [**FinishAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn652569).
trans-unit.target: When you are done capturing variable photo sequences or your app is suspending, clean up the variable photo sequence object by calling [**FinishAsync**](https://msdn.microsoft.com/library/windows/apps/dn652569).

trans-unit.source: Unregister the object's event handlers and set it to null.
trans-unit.target: Unregister the object's event handlers and set it to null.

trans-unit.source: CleanUpVPS
trans-unit.target: CleanUpVPS

trans-unit.source: Related topics
trans-unit.target: Related topics

trans-unit.target: Capture photos and video with MediaCapture
